data.title: Unique Italian Pizza
data.text: Great atmosphere, good food, and probably the most unique pizza dough we have eaten.  Prepare yourself for a taste treat with a mildly sweet dough and enjoy the flavor sensation.  The supper bar is a good value

data.title: Chicago style pizza in Colorado,
data.text: This is a nice place with great service and really good food. The pizza is Chicago style deeeeep dish and very good, the rest of the menu which we had three other items were outstanding. Kevin was our server and he is over the top. As I stated Chicago style pizza and a Chicago style city lots of shootings so beware. The same people who run Chicago run Pueblo.

data.title: Big Pizza
data.text: Very good pizza, with very thick crust and good sauce. Santa Fe location has a good atmosphere, with warm brick interior.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: We stopped in as we were leaving town and were very pleased. The service was great. The food was top notch. I had the steak philly, my daughter had ravioli, my husband had pasta. It was all very fresh. The salads were yummy too. I wish we lived here so we could come back again.

data.title: Great Thick, Slightly Sweet Crust Pizza
data.text:
My wife and I love driving down to Pueblo for some pizza at the Do Drop Inn. We were there on 4/2 and had the Taco Pizza. This is their thick, sweet crust covered with tomato sauce, hamburger, lots of cheese, salsa...then after cooking topped with lettuce. Wonderful! A warning to some who have never been here...the crust has a slight sweetness to it. Some may not like it, but we personally love the mix of sweet and savory that you get in their pizzas.

Although I have heard the service had gone downhill, we did not experience this. Our waiteress checked up on us to let us know the pizza was almost ready...warned us it would be a 30 minute cooking time, and kept our drinks full. Actually, I never remember a time I have received bad service there. 

The pizza was huge...I can down quite a bit of pizza and this one filled me after two slices. We took the rest home and enjoyed it again after warming it in the oven the next day.

So, if you are in the mood for a different type of thick crust pizza give them a try.

data.title: Pizza worth the wait!
data.text: When you go to the Do Drop be prepared to wait for your pizza to cook...the crust is thick and it takes a while to cook to perfection.  When the pie is delivered it will be one of the best you have tasted as it has a unique (sweet) taste.  This is our families first choice for pizza.

data.title: Great place to eat
data.text: We ate here on our family vacation. They have a very large menu. Italian, pizza, burgers, quesadillas and a bunch more. Good place to eat. Made from scratch pizza. Very nice staff. Takes some time to cook it so don't be in a hurry. 40 minutes minimum.

data.title: Good
data.text: Food is great. Love this pizza. I have been coming here for over 15 years. Service could be better. That is the only reason I didn't rate 5 stars. Good beer selection 10 or twelve on tap. Kinda pricy but in my opinion the best in town.

data.title: If you aren't from here, terrible.  Overpriced.
data.text: This pizza is really, really, really disgusting.  Almost inedible. Way overpriced- 20$ for a 16 inch cheese pizza.  That is completely absurd.   Apparently though, if you grew up eating it you still love it.  They do a good business and have people who are from here swear by it.  But if you are here from out of town, or just have a decent palate, do not eat the pizza here. Seriously.

data.title: Big Mistake
data.text:
I thought I did a review of this restaurant before but I guess not? Mind must be slipping? I started going to Do Drop 24 years ago, this time like the last two times I was disappointed, the pizza is not the same. So, this is the last time, I'll never return. The bottom of the pizza was very greasy, I've never had a pizza with a greasy bottom, sometimes a little on top, depends where you buy one. This combo just did not taste that good, so maybe the cook or ingredients?
The cost, almost $24.00 for 12" pizza?
Angelo's on Union Ave is much better.

data.title: Love their pizza
data.text: I generally go to the Pueblo West Do Drop Inn.  It is convenient and a great place to meet friends who are driving through.  It is just off Highway 50 and Purcell.  I have always been a big fan of Do Drop Inn pizza, but it doesn't please everyone's taste.  It has a very thick and slightly sweet crust.  It takes a long time to bake and it is a bit expensive for pizza.  But if you take into account that one piece and at the most two pieces will fill up everyone in the group it is a good choice.  I believe the last time I was there at lunch time they had a buffet and that was a good deal.  They had different types of pizza, pasta and salad.  That helps you get in and out faster at lunch.  I always recommend Do Drop to friends who want a great and unique pizza.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: We went to the Pueblo West location and had breakfast the green chili was excellent the hash browns were good the service was good prices were a little bit hi but we like the food what a good breakfast go there

data.title: Come Back~!
data.text: The first time we went here it was to Die For!!!  Delicious and Great Service, but, as we have continued to dine here, the service has slipped and the pizza just not what it used to be....  Don't get me wrong, but...  if you would have been fortunate enough to dine here 6, 7 maybe 8 years ago, you would have had a lifelong WONDERFUL memory, but of late...  not so good.  Please PLEASE Do Drop...Come back to what you were from yesteryear and allow me to reStar you at FIVE!!!  Bring UP the Service.  Pay attention to the Beauty you are serving, and for heavens sake, get a Bartender that knows what a Cosmopolitan is...  I know Pueblo isn't a Rockin Huge City, But a Cosmo has become a pretty basic staple...  Can't wait to return and find the return of the Wonderfulness you once were!  oh,, and be prepared to wait, because GREAT Pizza DOES Take Time!

data.title: Unique and delicous
data.text: Every experience I've had here has been a good one. Locally owned and operated, this amazing Italian cuisine adds a unique twist to your 'Average' pizza place

data.title: Best Pizza in Colorado
data.text: You can travel all over the world and not find a better pizza than Do Drop Inn.  As a kid we visited the "old" do drop inn and now they have the Pueblo West restaurant.  Either one is the best place to eat pizza in Pueblo, bar none.

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: I really liked the sweet style crust they had here. I thought the service was pretty good I couldn't complain. We had a coupon for a free pizza and it was great! The pizza was huge and while it did take a while to cook this is only because the pizza is large with a very thick crust. My hubby got full on one slice and so did the rest of us. A must try for a different style pizza when you get tired of the chain places. Oh the pizza is a little pricey so expect your bill to be at least $30+.

data.title: Different and Unique
data.text: Having heard a lot about the Do Drop Inn, we decided to to try it.  First the atmosphere was very neat, old Pueblo building  with a lot of historical pictures. service was very good.  We had buffet which was very inexpensive and they had happy hour prices on drafts.  Buffet did not have too big a selection but pastas were good and looked appetizing, there was salad, rolls and meatballs too as well as pizza.  The pizza is there flagship and is known for its uniqueness, sweet dough with beer.  The taste was found, but we found the pizza a little dense, meaning you had to cut with knife and certainly even two pieces filled up.  All and all a neat place, but definitely different pizza.

data.title: Always a delight and unbelieveable food
data.text: A stape of Pueblo, this place is always busy and for a good reason. delicious food, great prices. Can't beat their pizzas but they have a lot more to offer as well. Stingly suggest you try it at least once if you are in Pueblo...you'll be a fan for life.

data.title: you'll get full
data.text: If you like your pizza to fill you up, this is the one. It has a sweet crust and custom toppings but the combination of the crust and sauce make a pretty tasty pizza...You at least owe it to yourself to try one slice...

data.title: Awesome!
data.text: My family has been getting pizza from Do Drop for as long as I can remember, and now I take my kids there!  Great pizza, great ambiance, and great service...thanks Do Drop!
